text: what crates are you all using for linear algebra? There's like 20 of them and I don't see much clarity in why one over another. Benchmarks are also elusive.Maybe <@U69J94HT9> would have a suggestion?

elements.text: what crates are you all using for linear algebra? There's like 20 of them and I don't see much clarity in why one over another. Benchmarks are also elusive.Maybe

text: I use ndarray_linalg because I'm in the ndarray ecosystem when I do that sort of thing. But nalgebra is way more popular.

elements.text: I use ndarray_linalg because I'm in the ndarray ecosystem when I do that sort of thing. But nalgebra is way more popular.

text: How does it compare to say Eigen, Julia, or whatever else there is?

elements.text: How does it compare to say Eigen, Julia, or whatever else there is?

text: ndarray_linalg and Julia just link to other blas/lapack libraries from what I understand (I haven't looked at linear algebra in Julia in years so it may have changed), and Eigen and nalgebra implement most things themselves from what I understand. They're all very ergonomic from what I've seen.
